dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4770 IH: Regulatory Evidence-based Standards for Thorough Accountability and Reassuring Tests—Securing Updated and Necessary Statutory Evaluations Timely Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Schweikert introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committee on Small Business, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend chapter 6 of title 5, United States Code, to provide additional requirements for the periodic review of rules, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Regulatory Evidence-based Standards for Thorough Accountability and Reassuring Tests—Securing Updated and Necessary Statutory Evaluations Timely Act of 2025 or the RESTART SUNSET Act of 2025.

section.header: Additional requirements for periodic review of rules

subsection.text: Section 610 of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the first sentence, by striking Within one hundred and eighty days after the effective date of this chapter, each agency shall publish in the Federal Register a plan for the periodic review of the rules and inserting Each agency shall periodically review the rules;

by striking The plan shall provide for the review of all such agency rules existing on the effective date of this chapter within ten years of that date and for the review of such rules adopted after the effective date of this chapter within ten years of the publication of such rules as the final rule. and inserting Each agency shall review all such agency rules existing on the date of enactment of the RESTART SUNSET Act of 2025 within ten years of that date and review such rules adopted after the date of enactment of the RESTART SUNSET Act of 2025 within 10 years of the publication of such rules as the final rule.; and

in subsection (c), by adding at the end the following: Each year, each agency shall publish in the Federal Register a list of the rules which do not have a significant economic impact on a substantial number of small entities, and the basis for such conclusion..

subsection.text: Section 611(a) of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (4), by inserting except as provided in paragraph (5) before the court shall order;
by redesignating paragraph (5) as paragraph (6); and
by inserting after paragraph (4) the following:

Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, if the court finds that the agency failed to comply with section 610 with respect to a rule, the court shall enter an order prohibiting enforcement of such rule.
